comment: I wish all my General education classes had her as the professor. She makes the material easy to understand and realizes you have other classes to work on.

She's so nice if you pay attention in class and ask questions. However, her class is the hardest class I have ever taken. My anatomy and chemistry classes were easier than this. I prayed for a C in this class but I ended with a B. The content is literally elementary level work, but her tests are insane. They don't match the lectures or quizzes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Math 2008. She is a kind lady who cares about math concepts but is a tough grader. She will mark an entire question incorrect because you forgot to include 1 word that she was looking for. She doesn't display grades on D2L. 8 to 10 quizzes. 2-3 tests. I would not recommend taking her class unless you can dedicate a significant amount of time.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Rogers has pros and cons. She cares about the concepts and the lessons are interactive. She does grade attendance. I would've got an A but I got a B because I missed three classes. Overall, the concepts are fine if you pay attention. I thought they were pretty easy but some people thought they were hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I just walked out of her class for the last time and she is an absolutely awful teacher. Zero consideration for her students. She flat out said she wont upload our grades at home unless the school buys her phone plan because of Duo and thats a pretty accurate representation of how she treats the class in general. DO NOT TAKE EVEN IF YOU NEED
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Math is objective. If it was subjective, I guess I can see why people wouldn't rate her high. However, she comes off as wanting her students to genuinely to get good grades. She drops the lowest the lowest quiz and homework grades (wish it also included my test). There are also plenty of quizzes and homework which is a good thing.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: I am over halfway through with this class, and I can say that I do regret taking this course from her. She is nice sometimes, but she can be rude, especially if you ask a question during a test. Her tests do not line up with the quizzes and notes because she says things differently every single time, so you never know what she'll put on the tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: OKAY so this is my first semester at KSU after transferring and she is the only reason I regret transferring. She is so rude to students when they ask questions and I made straight up A's on every assignment until the tests... where I made a 75. She's inconsistent with grading and clearly hates to teach. Likes busywork and worships common core 0/10
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: What annoyed me the most was Professor Rogers telling us we needed to buy a bag of blocks from the bookstore, and we only used them once. It was a waste of 50 dollars. Also we had to buy an online code that she only gave two assignments on so that was also a waste of money. I was actually scared to ask questions because she would say something rude
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: This class is tough, not terms of the content, but because you are introduced to a whole new way of thinking. Ms. Rogers is definitely a hard person to get used to, and is pretty tough at times, but she cares about her students. You definitely have to work hard in this class. The exams are very difficult, just a heads up!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: The whole semester I loved Professor Rogers. I had an A, I always did well on her tests and quizzes, never missed a day of class. Then one day, during finals, my mind completely blanked and I forgot about an online test. Dropped my grade to a C. I emailed her seeing if I could retake and she refused. Because of this grade I have to change majors.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is a great professor. She explains everything thoroughly and makes sure you understand. Tests and quizzes are just like the examples she does in class, so if you pay attention you'll be golden. Easy A for sure.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Professor Rogers is a tough teacher; but she truly cares about what she does. She does NOT like for you to ask questions in class. She would rather you meet during her office hours or by email. By the end of the semester I come to realize she really is a great professor. Come to class do your work and you will pass. Utilize her office hours!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Rogers is a great teacher. If you show respect she will be respectful to you. Turn in all of the homework and quizzes and you will be fine. Study in groups for the tests and you will do good. Also, she gives lots of extra credit at the end of the semester, redo one quiz, partial credit on test, etc. Do NOT talk during class.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: If math isn't already your "god given talent" and you struggle most of the time, I wouldn't recommend her. She is very nice and caring but her grading criteria throws me off. She lectures heavy off of power points which made it hard for me to learn. Attendance isn't mandatory but she constantly changes her mind on quiz dates, test dates etc.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Mrs. Rogers is an alright teacher. She puts a burden of the learning on students, witch can be frusterating but it is her job. if you show respect to her, she will return it. if you just stay quiet and then talk to her at the end you will have problems.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Rogers was an excellent and engaging teacher. I would take her for all my ECE math courses if I could.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Prof Rogers is a good teacher, but if you ask her a question and don't understand the concept of the material she will say " guys we have been doing this for 2 weeks now" and she will either roll her eyes at your or give you sass. If you are good at math and understand material quick then take her if not then don't.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: This teacher is driving my anxiety level up and destroying my confidence. Whenever you ask her a question, it's wrong. We're expected to understand everything, even though she assigns homework and THEN goes over the concepts. Every class is served with a side of sass. And don't you dare ask a question, she'll roll her eyes at you.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: If you ask her a question, she will treat you like you are dumb. The tests are confusing, overly complicated, and hard to even finish on time. Definitely avoid taking her class, especially if you struggle with math.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY

comment: She makes the test hard doesn't answer you questions is rude to you don't take her class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--TEST HEAVY

comment: Her lectures and example problems are super easy, but when the tests comes she'll combine 2 or 3 things you learned into one problem. Her tests are not multiple choice and her tests can be unclear. If you struggle with math this class is not for you. Honestly, I wouldn't recommend this class to anyone. I took precalc and this class was 2xs harder.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Mrs. Roger's is tough, but fair. If you respect her then she will respect you back. The class seemed tough at first, but it just takes a little longer to adjust to a new way of thinking. Show up for class every day and ask questions and you will do good.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She was average at explaining the material,  but her tests were clunky and not always clear.  Unfortunately, she was not very receptive to answering questions. She also seemed to take things personally. She had an unnecessary "what I would call an adult temper tantrum" in class over not being heard, which made everyone uncomfortable.

It was very difficult to fully understand things as she taught it. If you had a question she made you feel like an idiot and look around the room with a look as if to say "can you believe he/she is asking this??" Takes it as a personal attack if you have a question. Grading is very vague and she is very unhelpful if you don't get the material.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She explains the material well and I almost always left with a solid understanding of topic covered in class. However, she tends to be a bit condescending at times, and often runs the class like a high school classroom. Tests are not too difficult, but always have a 25 pt. no partial-credit question, so you pretty much either get an A or below a C.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: She was decent overall.  She gives both paper and MML tests. The paper tests were always more difficult because she writes it so it's not always straight forward. The main thing that bothered me about this class was that I learned more on MML than in the actual class. She's a super lenient grader. Looks for and gives points when possible.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Best math teacher I've ever had. She taught things in a way that I could actually learn and took her time when students didn't understand. She drops 2 quizzes and some homework. She's taught all ages, so she knows how to adapt to different learning styles. Definitely recommend especially for intro math courses.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: very great professor. very great communicator of math concepts,she is very heavy on the "big picture". can use desmos on the tests in place of graphing calculator she can have a kind of attitude sometimes. she can also be a bit snappy at times, and answers questions a bit rude. gives good study guides. 6 test total, 25 hws(drops 5), abt 12 quizzes
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Did not like this class one bit, the only positive would be she is pretty laid back. Her test are pretty tricky, she will tell you she wants you to think " big picture". 6 total test, including the final which is cumulative. Quizzes and homework aren't bad. Half of the class dropped within a month. Would not recommend if your bad at math like me.

Depending on your personally, you may love or hate this class. I hated it. She gets off subject very easily and I am not exactly sure what she taught me this semester. I felt like I was getting through the class on prior knowledge. There is homework, quizzes, a project, and tests. Her motto this year was"No stressing", which was funny considering.
She is a good teacher. Sometimes confusing and way too enthusiastic about math. Some questions on the tests are crazy but you can figure them out. She is also very flexible.

Gives 2 online tests and 2 in class tests. Homework is all on my math lab. She doesn't like when you ask questions in the middle of lecture and she doesn't like when you pack up early. Pretty sassy, but overall gives a lot of partial credit. Make sure you listen when quizzes are due because I missed one due on a Sunday and got a 0. Would take again

She's an okay professor. I took her for college algebra (which was already easy to begin with), but she did kinda make things more clear for me. She takes attendance but you don't have to go. 2 tests online & 2 in class. I missed about 6 classes over the semester and still got a B.

I don't know why these reviews are so bad. This is such an easy class and she is an easy professor. 4 tests (2 in class, 2 online) quizzes, and all hw is online also. She is always willing to help and answer questions. Attendance is not mandatory, she posts everything online including study guides that are very similar to the actual test. Easy A.
She didnt help me at all

Don't take this class. Beth Rogers is not a good math teacher at all. Throughout High School I was always a low A, high B math student. I ended up with a C in her class. (First one ever) She does not put any grades in D2L, so you don't know where you stand until the end of the semester. It was a relief to get out of there, she is VERY  sarcastic.

She is very sarcastic and she talks a lot about her social life. She has 4 tests and she has several quizzes and a final. She drops the lowest hw grade and 2 quiz grades. She also gives practice tests which are somewhat helpful. The tests: 2 online and 2 in class. If you ask for help she will help you at. Attendance is optional but I suggest you go
Rogers is great. She is very knowledgeable and works hard to get everyone to understand the content. Take her if you want to learn.

If you are no good at math make sure you go to class! She is super helpful and understanding, and does what she can to make you understand. Do not buy the book. Her study guides are not helpful. Test questions come from phrases she says in her lectures and you always have to explain why, so make sure you understand everything in class.

Professor Rogers was very helpful. She provided multiple examples and made sure to appeal to each learning style. She is also a very fair grader. Drops two lowest homework grades, lowest quiz grade, and replaces your lowest test grade with that section of the final. Great professor overall.

Attendance is not mandatory. Her power-points are straight from the book so you really don't need the book. She's really obnoxious and doesn't teach very well. She is very sarcastic and it gets obnoxious but if you are good at math it is an easy A.

She is a smart aleck with a lot to say but doesn't know how to teach a class. She is decent one on one but isn't a good helper whatsoever. She does pointless examples and expects your to remember everything from pre-k
